content:
@o0Ignition0o - Jeremy Lempereur I find this document very explicative of how labels and priority levels are meant to work and their meaning:
https://hackmd.io/7NRRbq62TnaezW7-n15cDw

Is it still actual and relevant? Is it superseded by something else?

Would it make sense to move it under the HackMD Rust Compiler account with the "prioritization" tag (which I added to the doc)? I'd like to have it more promiment when looking at the list of WG-prio documents

I am having a look around to understand how things work, so expect dumb questions from me thanks for your patience :-)

Hey there :D sure dont hesitate!
This HackMD is indeed relevant, I'm supposed to add it to our forge at some point
If you have a question please let me know, maybe we can improve it further !
I think it can be merged / moved to forge as it is, looks great to my (still newbie) eye.
yeah, a PR on forge about this would be great
then we can also place our procedure there
Just opened https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-forge/pull/390, I was super _not sure_ where to put it, but you might be able to provide me with more details now that it s opened.
ok i wanted to address the issues, but gh is currently down so uh... :D
I've just read the PR and it looks great - just left a couple of tiny cosmetic nits
